thread.title: Big Foot’s spikers sew up 7th crown in RVC South
thread.title_full: Big Foot’s spikers sew up 7th crown in RVC South

author: Daily News staff
title: Big Foot’s spikers sew up 7th crown in RVC South
text: Larger font size Posted: Wednesday, October 7, 2015 4:00 pm Big Foot’s spikers sew up 7th crown in RVC South By Daily News staff beloitdailynews.com | 0 comments WALWORTH, Wis. — The Big Foot Chiefs clinched their seventh Rock Valley Conference South Division volleyball title with a sweep over visiting Clinton Tuesday night. It is Big Foot’s ninth title in the past 10 years. The Chiefs were led by junior Kennedy Hehr’s 16 kills and 13 digs. Freshman Kampbell Hehr added 35 assists and four aces, while Morgan Courier finished with three blocks. Clinton’s Arta Ashiku had five kills to pace the Cougars. • BELOIT TURNER 3, PALMYRA-EAGLE 1: The Trojans scored a home victory Tuesday night, defeating the Panthers in four sets (26-24, 25-10, 16-25, 25-12). Senior Ashley Himmelmann had eight kills and five aces while Clara Neupert had 22 digs to pace the Trojans. Emily Adas led Turner in assists with 19. The Trojans will close regular season play when they take on Brodhead Thursday night. • BRODHEAD 3, PARKVIEW 0: The Cardinals had little trouble with the host Vikings, sweeping them to assure them of a second-place finish in the Rock Valley Conference South Division standings. • HONONEGAH 2, BOYLAN 0: The Indians moved to 11-0 in NIC-10 play, sweeping Boylan in the process Tuesday night. The Indians took game one 25-17 before battling to a 25-22 victory in game two. • IHSA GOLF: The Hononegah Indians’ boys golf team continued its outstanding season with a convincing victory at the IHSA Class 3A regionals Tuesday. The meet, held at Atwood Homestead Golf Course, saw the Indians beat second-place DeKalb by 11 strokes. Hononegah senior Reid Anderson won the medalist award with a 72, and junior teammate Varun Menon was second with a 74. Ethan Neumer was next with a 77, while Adam Norwood finished with an 81. The Indians will stay in Rockford for the sectional meet, to be held Monday at Elliot Golf Course. • MIDDLETON 3, BELOIT MEMORIAL 0: Middleton had little trouble with the host Purple Knights at Barkin Arena, winning 25-11, 25-12, 25-23. Eva Laun-Smith led Beloit with five kills. Addision Brickson had an ace while Kenzie Hackett had six assists and Bailey Thomas six digs. Bree Swanson and India Godwin-Dorsey each had 1.5 blocks. Lily Welti paced Middleton with 16 kills and teammate Elizabeth Keller had 21 assists. • WIAA GOLF: Beloit Memorial’s Chloe Day saw her season come to an end with a 93 at the WIAA Division 1 sectional meet held in Mukwonago. Day, a sophomore, finished tied for 17th in the meet. Discuss Print Posted in Sports , Local sports , Prep , Prep sports , Scores , Sports news on Wednesday, October 7, 2015 4:00 pm.
